greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 1 + the number of unitary and squarefree divisors of n = number of divisors of reduced squarefree part of n.
comment: Note that 1 is regarded as free of squares of primes and is also a square number and a unitary divisor.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Steven R. Finch, Unitarism and Infinitarism, February 25, 2004. [Cached copy, with permission of the author]
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: Multiplicative with a(p) = 2 and a(p^e) = 1 for e > 1. a(n) = 2^A056169(n). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 01 2001
example: n = 252 = 2*2*3*3*7 has 18 divisors, 8 unitary and 8 squarefree divisors of which 2 are unitary and squarefree, divisors {1,7};
n = 2520 = 2*2*2*3*3*5*7 has 48 divisors, 16 unitary and 16 squarefree divisors of which {1,5,7,35} are both, thus a(2520) = 4.
mathematica: Table[DivisorSum[n, 1 &, And[SquareFreeQ@ #, CoprimeQ[#, n/#]] &], {n, 105}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 19 2017 *)
f[p_,e_] := If[e==1, 2, 1]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[n]); Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, May 14 2019 *)
program: A057521(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); prod(i=1, #f~, if(f[i, 2]>1, f[i, 1]^f[i, 2], 1)); } \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 13 2013
A055229(n) = { my(c=core(n)); gcd(c, n/c); }; \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 20 2012
(Scheme) (define (A056671 n) (if (= 1 n) n (* (if (= 1 (A067029 n)) 2 1) (A056671 (A028234 n))))) ;; (After the given multiplicative formula) - _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 19 2017
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else prod([2 if e==1 else 1 for p, e in factorint(n).items()])
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jul 19 2017
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Aug 10 2000
